title: Web Basics
description: Learn how websites work using simple real-life examples

refresher.title: What is a Website?
refresher.content:
# Real-Life Story: Building Your First Toy Shop

Imagine this.

You decide to open a small toy shop in your neighborhood. It is your first business, and you want people to feel happy and comfortable the moment they walk in.

Before opening day, you start preparing everything carefully.

---

## What Does a Real Toy Shop Need?

First, your shop needs a clear identity so people understand what it is.

- A board with the shop name, so people know what the shop is
- Toys arranged neatly on shelves, so customers can easily see and choose
- Someone to open the door, greet customers, and help them

If any one of these is missing, the shop feels confusing or incomplete.

A website works in the exact same way.

---

## A Website Is Like a Digital Shop

When someone opens a website:

- They should immediately understand what the website is about
- It should look clean, organized, and attractive
- It should respond when they click buttons or interact with it

To make all this happen, every website is built using three core technologies.

---

## The Three Important Parts of a Website

### HTML â€” Structure

HTML is the structure of the website.

Just like the walls, shelves, and counters in a toy shop, HTML decides:

- What content exists on the page
- Where headings, text, images, and buttons are placed

Without HTML, there is nothing to see on a website.

---

### CSS â€” Style

CSS controls how the website looks.

It is responsible for:

- Colors and fonts
- Spacing and layout
- Overall visual appearance

A shop without decoration feels dull. In the same way, a website without CSS looks plain and unattractive.

CSS makes a website pleasant to look at and easy to use.

---

### JavaScript â€” Behavior

JavaScript is the brain of the website.

It controls how the website behaves when users interact with it. For example:

- What happens when a button is clicked
- Showing or hiding content
- Validating forms
- Running logic and actions

Without JavaScript, a website may look fine but feels lifeless.

---

## What Happens If One Part Is Missing?

- Without HTML, nothing exists
- Without CSS, content exists but looks unattractive
- Without JavaScript, the website does not respond to user actions

All three are required to build a complete and functional website.

---

## Simple Rule to Remember

- HTML shows what is there
- CSS shows how it looks
- JavaScript shows how it behaves

This simple rule will guide you throughout your web development journey.

positive.code: My Toy Shop
positive.explanation:
**How this works:**

- `<h1>` is HTML (structure)
- `color: blue` is CSS (style)
- `onclick` is JavaScript (action)

All three work together like a team.

negative.title: Common Confusion
negative.description: This page shows text but button does nothing. Why?
negative.question: Why does nothing happen when clicking?

options.explanation: Correct. Without JavaScript, buttons cannot perform actions.
CSS only changes looks, not actions.

negative.lesson:
HTML creates the button.
JavaScript gives it life.
